titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Stephen E. Herbits Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Aparna Mukherjee; machine-readable finding aid created by James Ryan

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-02-06T09:36-0800

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the online catalog.
did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, reports, memoranda, notes, and printed matter, relating to proposals for an all-volunteer armed force, Congressional action on the proposals, and evaluation of the new volunteer system in operation. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Stephen E. Herbits papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1975.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Staff member, Wednesday Group, House of Representatives, United States Congress
Commissioner, President's Commission on All Volunteer Armed Force
Project Leader, Open Presidency Task Force Study of Progress on Achieving an All Volunteer Force
Staff Assistant to Senator Robert T. Stafford, Vermont, United States Congress
Special Assistant to the Assistant Secretary of Defense (Manpower and Reserve Affairs), United States Government

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters arranged alphabetically by correspondent. Includes a few letters neither from nor to Stephen Herbits.

did.unittitle: McGee, Alexander, Jr., Mr. and Mrs.,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical note, briefing notes, daily file, financial records, memoranda, notes, press release, printed matter, reading files, reports and schedule, relating to his office work and to the issue of organizing a union for the servicemen, arranged alphabetically by physical form. It also includes the work accomplished by the Commission on an All Volunteer Armed Force, of which Stephen Herbits was a member. See also DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE FILE and SUBJECT FILE.

did.unittitle: Reading files. Includes charts, clippings, correspondence, memoranda, minutes of meetings, notes, remarks and statements
September. Report was prepared by Stephen Herbits, John Johnston and Andy Uscher
Commission on an All Volunteer Armed Force
Press release. It mentions Stephen Herbits as the youngest member of the Commission

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Budget, bulletins, charts and graphs, clippings, compensation and benefit records, correspondence, court proceedings, enlistment records, health records, housing records, interviews, memoranda, minutes of meetings, news briefings and press conferences, newsletters, notes, pamphlets, press release, printed matter, programs, proposals, reading files, remarks, reports, schedule, statements, telegrams and television news reports, relating to the Department of Defense in general and the army, marine corps and navy in particular, arranged alphabetically by physical form. It also includes records dealing specifically with the questions of the draft, selective service system and with the publication of the book "How to End the Draft: The Case for an All Volunteer Army." See also OFFICE FILE and SUBJECT FILE.

did.unittitle: Reading files 1973-1974. Includes charts, clippings, correspondence, memoranda, minutes of meetings, notes, remarks and statements
Subject file. Women in defense forces
Reading files. Includes charts, clippings, correspondence, memoranda, minutes of meetings, notes, remarks and statements
February. Includes background information about Stephen E. Herbits

"How to end the draft: The Case for an All Volunteer Army". Stephen Herbits provided the authors, Congressmen Frank J. Horton, Richard S. Schweiker, Garner E. Shriver, Robert T. Stafford and Charles W. Whalen, Jr., with research and editorial assistance for writing this book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bills and amendments, clippings, correspondence, hearings and testimonies, interviews, memoranda, newsletters, notes, press release, printed matter, remarks, reports, statements, status reports and miscellany, relating to the United States Congress and to the executive departments of the government, arranged alphabetically by physical form.

did.unittitle: Reports. One was prepared by Stephen Herbits

odd.head: General note
odd.p: See also DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE FILE

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Charts, newsletters, printed matter relating to the Department of Defense, the army and the Congress arranged alphabetically by physical form. It also includes uncorrected advance proof of a book about the volunteer army. See also DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE FILE.

did.unittitle: Marmion, Harry A., "The Case Against a Volunteer Army", 1971. Uncorrected advance proof

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memos, working papers, etc., primarily relating to the military draft, volunteer military service, and the military budget

did.unittitle: 1 print depicting Byron V. Pepitone, acting director, National Selective Service,
